questiontext.text:
Characterize the next change in an airline company as primarily change in the O-, I- or D-organisation:

The possibility to book ﬂights on the web site of the company.

Characterize the next change in an airline company as primarily change in the O-, I- or D-organisation:

The possibility to check-in on the web site of the company.

Characterize the next change in an airline company as primarily change in the O-, I- or D-organisation:

The possibility to download the boarding pass on your smart phone instead of printing it.

Characterize the next change in an airline company as primarily change in the O-, I- or D-organisation:

The possibility to be informed by the company about ﬂight delays, etc.

Characterize the next change in an airline company as primarily change in the O-, I- or D-organisation:

The possibility to rent a car in addition to booking ﬂights.

Indicate the next changes in the company WholyPharm (case below) as primarily changes in the O-organisation (by an “O”), the I-organisation (by an “I”) or the D-organisation (by a “D”):

Informing customers about intended changes in the assortment of articles.

Case:

WholyPharm is a wholesale company in the pharmaceutical sector. Their customers are pharmacies, both private ones and hospital pharmacies. The pharmacies have a long-term relationship with the company, laid down in long-term contracts. This falls outside the scope of the case, however. The case only concerns what is described hereafter. Whenever there is a need, a pharmacy places an order, with reference to its current long-term contract, on the company’s website. An order regards a number of items of one article (kind). The customers of WholyPharm have access to the (digital) article assortment (called the article base), from which they select the articles they want to order. If a customer order can be delivered, WholyPharm sends a confirmation e-mail to the customer. In addition, the corresponding invoice is sent. In order to save transport costs, WholyPharm collects weekly all purchase orders of every pharmacy, and delivers the articles in one shipment. Next to this process, separate shipments may be carried out (at an extra price) for urgent orders (to be indicated by the customer). The article base is managed, on a monthly basis, by a specific department of the company. To perform this task, one keeps up-to-date knowledge of the market of pharmaceutical products, as well as knowledge of the purchase behaviour of the customers of WholyPharm. As a result, new articles may be added (Note: the removal of articles is disregarded). Next to this article base management process, customers can also ask to add articles that they are interested in. To do this, they have to fill out a so-called NewArt form, and to submit the form by postal mail.

Indicate the next changes in the company WholyPharm (case below) as primarily changes in the O-organisation (by an “O”), the I-organisation (by an “I”) or the D-organisation (by a “D”):

Outsourcing the shipments of purchased articles to an external company.

Case:

WholyPharm is a wholesale company in the pharmaceutical sector. Their customers are pharmacies, both private ones and hospital pharmacies. The pharmacies have a long-term relationship with the company, laid down in long-term contracts. This falls outside the scope of the case, however. The case only concerns what is described hereafter. Indicate the next changes in the company WholyPharm (case below) as primarily changes in the O-organisation (by an “O”), the I-organisation (by an “I”) or the D-organisation (by a “D”):

Sending an SMS to confirm a customer order, in addition to the e-mail.

Characterise the next changes in the case Pizzeria (DEMO Bachelor course) as primarily changes in the O-organisation, the I-organisation or the D-organisation:

Ordering pizza’s via the new Mama Mia website, next to making telephone calls.

Characterise the next changes in the case Pizzeria (DEMO Bachelor course) as primarily changes in the O-organisation, the I-organisation or the D-organisation:

Paying in advance for orders that are placed via the website.

Characterise the next changes in the case Pizzeria (DEMO Bachelor course) as primarily changes in the O-organisation, the I-organisation or the D-organisation:

Having the delivery boys use a navigator app on their smart phone to get travel directions.

Characterise the next changes in the case Pizzeria (DEMO Bachelor course) as primarily changes in the O-organisation, the I-organisation or the D-organisation:

Outsourcing the delivery of pizza’s to an external delivery company.

Characterise the next changes in the case Pizzeria (DEMO Bachelor course) as primarily changes in the O-organisation, the I-organisation or the D-organisation:

Informing customers via the website about the progress of the completion of their orders.

Characterise the next changes that an online bookshop makes as primarily changes in the Oorganisation, the I-organisation or the D-organisation:

Informing customers via the website about the progress of the completion of their orders.

Characterise the next changes that an online bookshop makes as primarily changes in the Oorganisation, the I-organisation or the D-organisation:

Offering travel services, next to selling books.

Characterise the next changes that an online bookshop makes as primarily changes in the Oorganisation, the I-organisation or the D-organisation:

Outsourcing the delivery of books to an external parcel transport company.

Characterise the next changes that an online bookshop makes as primarily changes in the Oorganisation, the I-organisation or the D-organisation:

Letting regular customers pay afterwards for book orders, next to paying in advance.

Characterise the next changes that an online bookshop makes as primarily changes in the Oorganisation, the I-organisation or the D-organisation:

Charging regular customers automatically a 5% discount on every book order.

Characterize the next change in company WholyPharm as primarily change in the O-, I- or D-organisation:

Informing customers about intended changes in the assortment of articles.

Characterize the next change in company WholyPharm as primarily change in the O-, I- or D-organisation:

Outsourcing the shipments of purchased articles to an external company.

Characterize the next change in company WholyPharm as primarily change in the O-, I- or D-organisation:

Sending an SMS to conﬁrm a customer order, in addition to the e-mail.

Characterize the next change in company WholyPharm as primarily change in the O-, I- or D-organisation:

Giving customers access to their order history.

Characterize the next change in company WholyPharm as primarily change in the O-, I- or D-organisation:

Making the submission form digital as an alternative to paper submitted by post.
